alert.note: Alert for Bamberg; Calhoun (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Bamberg, Calhoun and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Some areas of concern are flood prone areas within the City of Orangeburg. This includes the area along the Sunnyside Canal area and Malibu Drive. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orangeburg, Brookdale, St. Matthews, Orangeburg County Airport, South Carolina State University, Claflin College, Edisto Gardens, Cameron, Neeses, Norway, Rowesville, Cordova, Cope, Wilkinson Heights, Edisto, Prince of Orange Mall and Yonder Field. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 90 and 93. Interstate 26 between mile markers 141 and 163. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
